subject: Is it possible to enable assertions in the JUnit Ant task?
msgSnippet: Hello. I have an Ant build file with test target that runs all JUnits tests. The documentation for the JUnit task states that it allows nested assertions
messageBody:
Hello.

I have an Ant build file with "test" target that runs all JUnits
tests.
The documentation for the "JUnit" task states that it allows
nested "assertions" element that should enable assertions in all user
code or in specific classes or packages.

I have tried to use it but assertions were not enabled! :-(
I do compile all my classes with source="1.4" and i tried to
place "assert false;" statement somewhere in the code. It was not
triggred when ant task was used but it throws an exception if i run
tests from the command line with "java -ea path.to.test.suite".

There is the fragment of build script:
<junit failureproperty="test.failed"
printsummary="${test.printsummary}">
<classpath refid="test.classpath"/>
<assertions>
<enable/>
</assertions>
<formatter type="xml" usefile="true"/>
<batchtest todir="${test.destination}">
<fileset dir="${test.source}">
<include name="**/*TestCase.java"/>
</fileset>
</batchtest>
</junit>

Is this feature broken or am i missing something?
